cluster_relations.rel_desc: Grave goods are intended to provide comfort to the deceased in the afterlife.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is intended to provide a specific benefit or provision (here, to the deceased) in the context of the afterlife.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: if the deceased reaches the afterlife

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Grave goods are also intended to provide sustenance to the deceased in the afterlife.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is intended to provide a specific benefit or provision (here, to the deceased) in the context of the afterlife.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: for the deceased in the afterlife

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Food offerings are meant as provisions for the deceased in the afterlife.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is intended to be used in or within a particular context or realm (here, by the deceased in the afterlife).
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is intended, within ancient Egyptian belief, to provide use, sustenance, or other benefits to the deceased in the afterlife.
args.justification: All three relations describe the same underlying predicate: items (grave goods or food offerings) are intended to benefit or provision the deceased in the afterlife. Unifying the canonical_rel_name and description to a single, domain-appropriate predicate avoids having two near-duplicate predicates ('intended_to_provide' and 'intended_for_use_in') for the same semantics while keeping the existing relation class and group (afterlife_provision_relation, USAGE) intact.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is intended, within ancient Egyptian belief, to provide use, sustenance, or other benefits to the deceased in the afterlife.
executed_decisions.justification: All three relations describe the same underlying predicate: items (grave goods or food offerings) are intended to benefit or provision the deceased in the afterlife. Unifying the canonical_rel_name and description to a single, domain-appropriate predicate avoids having two near-duplicate predicates ('intended_to_provide' and 'intended_for_use_in') for the same semantics while keeping the existing relation class and group (afterlife_provision_relation, USAGE) intact.
